place_description:
The Everyday Market is a community-focused cafe that strives to create simple and delicious made-from-scratch food paired with exceptional coffee.
Taking inspiration from European cafes, The Everyday Market offers a space for the community near and far to relax and escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

The team, led by pastry chef / owner Majid Amoorpour, are happy to be part of Belmont’s historic downtown and would love for you to come spend some time with us.

The second Everyday Market location recently opened in the vibrant Lower South End district of Charlotte, NC.

reviews_data.review_text: may have found the best breakfast burrito in CLT metro
Very unique! Whoever designed the food menu and the bakery did an outstanding job. I would go there often. Delicious and quick.
Always a good time. Great people and great food and dessert offerings!

Bustling eatery in downtown Belmont. Prompt & friendly service. Food & coffee were good. The made to order breakfast items are a tad pricey and available seating was a bit sparse on a Sunday morning, but we enjoyed our meal overall & grabbed some treats to go.
Great coffee and snack spot, very homey
One of the best cafes in CLT.  Food is gourmet level. Cute town of Belmont just a few miles from the airport.

Made the 35 minute trip to The Everyday Market one Saturday morning and it was definitely worth the drive!  The place was very crowded but our drink came out quickly and the food was ready shortly after.  We ordered the Teddy Bear Latte, Avocado Toast and the Chicken Avocado Wrap.  Everything tasted great.  Highly recommend The Everyday Market!
The staff are always so kind! We frequently stop in for a cookie or pastry, but my favorite is the egg, ham and cheese croissant.

EDIT: 3/10/25 I fell in love with this little local spot so much that I mentioned to someone they should apply there and it seemed like a place they'd enjoy working. After a few months there have been SEVERAL issues with pay, scheduling, communication and overall professionalism. Clearly the owner and his sidekick have no idea how to treat employees. I regret that I have spent so much money at this establishment and told so many people to try them. There are too many great coffee shops in the city, don't support places that treat the very people that run it like trash.

I can't believe we haven't come here. This is a hidden gem. The coffee is perfect and all the great pastries and food. Iced vanilla lattes and Iced chai latte were perfect. Spicy turkey sandwich was a hit. The tomato bisque soup was my favorite. The egg and cheese croissant was good too. We will be coming back and def going to come here and work.

I absolutely love going here. They have the best bakery/pastries. Their breakfast menu is amazing as well. Worth every penny. I highly recommend their macarons, bread pudding, and any breakfast sandwich or burritos.

Food, coffee, pastries, and desserts! The Everyday Market has it all and it is all fantastic! There are very few things that I haven't had from here at this point and everything has been completely on point and wonderful. I would highly recommend coming here for coffee, dessert, and food.
Excellent place and very cozy.
What a gem. Met a friend here, and she said it reminded her of Connecticut.  Delightful lunch, and I took home desserts for my husband and myself. Will definitely be going back.

Customer service is weird, almost fake nice. One time I asked for butter and it became an entire operation to get butter which I never got. Another time I asked for honey before paying for a hot tea, and they say yes, we have honey ok good. Bought the tea and asked for the honey, and they said  sorry we don't have honey. They brush you off real quick

This is a wonderful cafe and coffee shop with very good bakery fare.  The people who work here are just incredibly helpful and pleasant and attentive.   Amazing to experience this in the age of Starbucks.  Blech.  This place is for real.   Crowded on weekends.  I wish they had more gluten free but th coconut macarons are very very good.
Friendly staff and delicious pastries! The Macarons are delicious, very rich flavor; and the strudel is to die for!

I ordered two avocado chicken wraps yesterday that gave us horrible food poisoning.  Called to let the staff know, was told thanks we'll let the kitchen know and hung up on me. Not even an apology, which would be the minimum customer service a restaurant can provide.

Update: they called back an hour after this and offered a refund for the wraps in my order (not entire order).

First time experience for both of us and so disappointed. Coffee was good. Egg was underdone and croissant was overdone. Raspberry rugalach had almost no taste. Cost would indicate a much better experience.   :(
This place is a must go! Everything is fresh, made, and incredible. This is our gateway stop, trigger, that we are leaving home and headed to the mountains.

We was in Belmont looking for a place for lunch , stumbled across (the everyday)  . The best  experience eating lunch for  my wife and I had in a long time. A little pricey.. but great. Can't wait to go back!!
Great food and customer service

Little Gem in Belmont, think Panera but local.. and better.
The service was outstanding and very accommodating.
Normally places like this don't have stellar coffee, instead both the food and coffee were amazing .
Always Great!  Try the Breakfast Burritos or Almond Croissants, Fabulous Food.  Bring your Doggie for a walk in the park too!
Best lattes in the area.    Good food, but a bit pricey.   Always busy.
A local Gem. Great foods (dessert type and some others). Great coffee and they have other items for sale, as wine, pasta, crackers, sauces, etc.

Really nice spot on Main Street in Belmont. Perfect place to get some work done or read quietly with coffee. Staff was very friendly, service was prompt. Plenty of places to sit even though it was fairly busy around lunch time.

Food was outstanding- had a ham, egg and cheese sandwich on a bagel and it was delicious, one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had. The cold brew coffee was very good. Entire cafe was clean and nicely decorated. There's a nice park across the street as well. It was also easy to find parking.

They had a small beer selection and wine as well. Great place.

Super cute coffee house with baked goodies like croissants, breakfast sandwiches, and dessert pastries as well. In a great setting downtown Belmont, with indoor and outdoor seating, right across from the park. Staff was friendly and coffee was delicious.
Clean.  I was looking for sandwich or salad, but didn't have .
Best, friendliest bakery in metro Charlotte!

Ordered a egg and cheese coirsant. The egg was under cooked and the sandwich was cold. The espresso isn't the best I have had either. Staff don't tell you where to pick up your food so you just have to figure it out yourself. Never again.
Our experience was FANTASTIC and the smoothies were great! I also had cheesecake for breakfast! LOL! I couldn't resist
AMAZING EXPERIENCE,  MY SMOOTHIE WAS DELICIOUS

MUST VISIT!! This is the most amazing place. We ordered a croissant with Brie cheese and apricot, blueberry cheesecake and a latte. Absolutely  everything was perfect! Best cheesecake I've ever had. Staff is great. Go, grab your coffee and something to eat (very hard to pick only one!!), sit  outside and enjoy the view of a gorgeous park ;)

The coffee hit the spot. One of the best mixed berry muffins I've had. My husband has a pumpkin and cream cheese one. He also liked his.
Very cute cafe/ market.
We will be back.

Great food, coffee, and desserts in a cozy little restaurant. We went on a Sunday late morning/early afternoon and it was crowded but that was to be expected and we certainly didn't mind. Worth the money spent!!
I have loved this place from day one and it is now my favorite coffee shop/ lunch date with friends spot. The food is as impressive as the coffee and oh goodness, those desserts are divine!

Everything I ever tried is delicious.  Their cheesecake is my favorite cheesecake.  Im
Obsessed with it.

I asked for a bacon egg and cheddar cheese croissant. I was told by the person at the front checkout the cheese comes melted in the egg mixture. I then asked can you just add a cheddar slice to the croissant? I could have dealt with the cheese being in the mixture I just wanted an added cheddar slice to it. She then goes to ask the chef and I was not present in the conversation of what she asked but he came back to say I could not have an added slice of cheddar on my croissant?!? You have cheese and ham on a baguette but you can't serve me cheddar on a freaking croissant?!? Then there were no clean utensils so I could eat my food so I start cutting into my food so the fork melted into my food.
All The food is good, all of the coffee drinks are good. There is a reason this place is always full during business hours.

Wow wow wow! This has easily become my favorite cafe in the area from the handful of times I've went. Incredible quality all around, I have yet to have something I've not loved. The caprese sandwich was super flavorful and refreshing, and the focaccia it's served on with olives and tomatoes is to die for. Cheesecake was like heaven. Just sweet enough (I dislike things that are overly sweet), not dense but light. The fresh fruit along with it is such a good pairing. All of the staff have been wonderful, very accommodating and welcoming. I can't wait to go back again!

Everything about this place is amazing from the coffee, to the food, the selection of  wine, atmosphere and most importantly the service is amazing.  Only thing that would make this place better is gluten-free and vegan options. Also, the addition of coconut milk to the latte menu!!
Great little place for conversation and wine.
My Belmont go to for coffee, dessert and breakfast. This cozy cafe serves up a mean avocado toast and provides a chill space to relax. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Cronuts are delicious!!
Almond croissant is to die for!

The caprese sandwich I had here today is the best I've ever eaten. Delicious focaccia bread, fresh spinach, basil, balsamic vinegar, juicy tomatoes, and generous mozzarella. I only regret I didn't get a photo before I tore into it. I will absolutely be back -- as soon as I can! -- for another one.

My fiance had a breakfast burrito that was likewise very tasty. We grabbed desserts on our way out the door that I can't wait to try.

So glad this spot is open in Belmont. I can't wait for my next sandwich!

Editing to add: we ate our blueberry cheesecake, chocolate chip cookie, and lemon bar as soon as we got home. Phenomenal. Couldn't choose a favorite but all were perfect. The chocolate ganache is also incredible -- tried it the other day.

We've been to Everyday Market many times and have typically had good service but that changed today. They were busy as they usually are, our order was taken and we were waiting off to the side for our drinks. My drink was ready first and my son's smoothie was in the process of being made when another worker who appeared to be in training still set the same smoothie he had ordered in front of us. My son grabbed it thinking it was his and her response was "that's not yours, I didm't take your order!" My son and I looked at each other both bothered by the response and lack of customer service speak. She then asked the girl that took our order if she was making ours and she said yes, that she was getting on it. I appreciate communication and good customer service skills and felt like this trip lacked both. My son is not interested in returning anytime soon, I however will give them another try to see if there is any improvement. I believe in second chances when other experiences have been decent.
Great food!

First, the avocado toast is enough for two people, if you're kidding to share! We were happy to see that since we were thinking of getting one for both of us 
Of what we had, the food was all very good. We took a torte cake home as well as a slice of bread pudding. The cake was incredible, we might make the 45 minute drive again for another piece...

The staff were so friendly, efficient, and helpful for our first time visit. The porchetta sandwich was amazing, full of flavor and just the right amount of arugula. To top off the lunch we ordered tiramisu that was made in house - delicious and light with chocolate shavings! The espresso was perfect!
Usually good, but this time the staff were extremely rude. I understand y'all aren't making much but treat people the way you wish to be treated for Christ sakes.

We came here to work after a storm knocked our power out for the day. The food, coffee, WiFi, atmosphere were all 10/10! We had the ham quiche and a tomato bisque - both were excellent and filling. I think the bisque was just a daily special but it should definitely be added to the permanent menu! They also have a great bakery selection that we'll definitely be back for.
Keep doing what you're doing. No complaints at all. Service is great, selection is great, and I'd recommend this spot to anyone.
Always go where the locals go, so we did! Great coffee bar and home-baked croissants, scones, etc. We even came back for a bottle of rose and evening snacks.
South End location is fabulous! The Flatbread, Cappuccino, and Princess Torte was incredible.
Great small bakery cafe, with good coffee--and lunch! Plenty of seating and nice staff
Fresh Toast is spectacular
Alway had a great experience.  And the food never disappoints.
The smoked salmon toast and French toast are must tries. If you have the chance buy a bottle of wine, sit outside and watch the world go by. Very relaxing after eating such great food!

This is a great addition to the places to eat in Belmont....
The focaccia is fantastic!
Great coffee, good selection of cakes and desserts....
Great coffee, great breakfast. Only wish iced tea was available!
Wonderful place. Amazing staff. The food is top notch. It's a must place the place is a must stop if in Belmont.

I was very hungry, so I decided to pop in here for a bite.  Ordered the Caprese sandwich....OMG.  Fantastic!  Made on delicious foccaccia (sp?).  Huge serving....but I managed to eat the whole thing!  So glad I stopped.  Friendly staff.

One of the most delightful, incredible, and then disastrous experiences that I've ever had in a restaurant.

The everyday market, was presented to us as an incredible amazing restaurant. They told me there was amazing food, there was amazing pastries, and the coffees were to die for.

I went into the restaurant and ordered caprese sandwich and a bowl of tomato bisque.

The sandwich was incredible, the balsamic vinaigrette was off the char rich delicious, and the bread was covered in black olives and onion strips, and it was just a fantastic combination for sandwich. The basil pesto was to die, for it was so rich and delicious.

The tomato bisque was one of the greatest tomato soup I ever changed in my life. To the point, my friend tasted it, and she went and got herself her own bowl because of how incredible it tasted.

This event was during the festival, where there were so many outside vendors that you could choose to eat from. Which the children did. But we chose to eat inside because we were so excited about the stories how incredible the atmosphere and everything would be.

So as we're eating, the little girl with us is eating a pizza, that she got from the location outside that was directly in front of their field. There was several other people in the building, including an older gentleman and his wife and his daughter, two younger children, and then another family all eating outside food.

The kids finished their food the lady and the gentleman and their daughter who was older, we're having conversation yet the employee approached the little girl with us.

She told us that it was against health coat violation for her to eat outside food inside of their store. Which is incorrect because that is not a health violation anyway shape or form at any restaurant in the world. Because we all have eaten other food in other places. When your kids don't want to eat somewhere and they prefer something else. How many times have you taken them McDonald's chicken nuggets into somewhere.

We couldn't figure it out, but we didn't understand why the little girl was the only person approached yet the gentleman who was white, the lady and their older child who was white and the children and the younger family on the other side who were white, were clearly sitting there eating outside food.

The little black girl that was with us was the only person approached. Was it stereotypical racism from someone in that Belmont atmosphere?  It wasn't high enough to be in establishment.?

It was extremely disheartening, it turned, we wanted our money back. We wanted to leave the restaurant. We did not want to partake in shape or form the success of this business.

Yes, we sat there and finished our food. We did not ask for our money back.  And and the little girl asked if she could just finish her pizza. The employee looked around the corner and out the windows at a location where we can go sit outside area, but we did not get up.

The child's mother who is white, walked up and asked to speak to this woman. And when she asked the woman why she didn't walk around incorrect everyone else in the building. She said it's OK. She can sit there and finish it. You'll just know better next time. But yeah, never said anything to the older couple, the younger couple or the group of children. All happened to be Caucasian.

And to top it off, even though myself and her mother were eating their food from there we had beverages from another location so us being white, we weren't corrected either but the little black girl sitting with us was corrected.
A hidden treasure in Belmont with exceptional service, outstanding bakery items, and delicious coffee. The atmosphere is invigorating after a stroll or jog, making it an Everday must-visit spot.

A local cafe with made from scratch bakery goods and sandwiches paired with delicious coffee drinks.

Staff super friendly and filled with many regular customers.

Located on Main St. In the charming town of Belmont NC.

I had a cold brew coffee and homemade lemon pound cake and my wife had a coffee and a macaron.

Everything was delicious. Plenty of street parking available.

Absolutely top notch- we are across the tracks but would travel much much further for this place. Excellent place to grab a coffee, sandwich or wine! The deserts are also unreal. Everything is so good.
Always  great. I go a lot. It's such a great place for food and just to sit and have a coffee.
Great cheese cake

Excellent wine selection, limited but delicious breakfast and lunch options, great freshly made in-house desserts! Love the people here and it's just a feel good kind of place. Always a treat! Love their outdoor patio.
Picked up 2 nice pecan pie slices to go with the butter pecan ice cream I had in freezer. Hubbies Birthday and it is one of his favorite pies!

Small and intimate and could mean quaint or lod and crowded based on time of day.

Bit on the pricey side, but aren't most places recently?
This place is an absolute gem- good food, amazing deserts, good coffee, nice people, perfect location.  Our little town is so much better with The Everyday Market.
Outstanding staff! Friendly AND efficient!   All pastries and drinks we got were fantastic!    Our first but definitely not our last visit!
Delicious soups. Tomato Bisque and lentil soup are delicious!
All their food and pastry is tasty but the cheesecake is amazing! You have to try it. Can't wait for them to open another location in Charlotte!

This place is great and very crowded so when you come try to miss peak times of the day I love it will always come here to get my coffee I even messed up my order and they fixed it right away thank you guys for great service
Loved this coffee shop/ market.  Wonderful service,  cute and clean,  and very yummy coffee and breakfast.  The ham,  brie, and apricot croissant was sooooo good.  I look forward to going back.

Was having a bad day and wanted to treat myself. Use to go to places for just coffee and dessert and haven't found a lot of places to do that anymore. This place was perfect. Very relaxing and welcoming. Got to have, coffee, dessert and read my book. Just what I needed. They also serve sandwiches, soups and salad as well as have a large selection of beers and wines. You can also buy pasta to cook at home. This place has a lot to offer and just what I needed. Highly recommend
A treasure of a place
Neat little place. Great tasting coffee and delicious pastries.

Cute coffee shop with some pre-made sandwich items. Good coffee, friendly staff.
A bit noisy and tables very close together.
Counter service!
This is by far the best food I have had in a long time. Everything we ordered was DELICIOUS!! Please give it a try!
I loved this place
Everything here is so delicious!
Love this place. Sandwiches are amazing, as is the Tiramisu, Macarons, and choose cake. Their bread is next level.

Nice place to have meeting with you favorite person. I love the atmosphere. The food was amazing. I had ham egg and cheese sandwich on the everything bagel. And my partners had avocado toast. The combination of flavor it was amazing highly recommend.

First time visiting. We had a large party, so ordering was a bit of a challenge. The food selections were good, everyone found something they liked. Indoor and outdoor seating, kid friendly, not sure about dogs, maybe outside ok. Beer and wine are available. We didn't get any sweets, but they looked tempting. Cute little spot in downtown Belmont. Parking could be an issue during busy times, you may have to walk a block or two. Would love to come back and try other items.
Enjoyed the avocado toast. Dined outside.

Quaint, personable, and delicious.

Sporting a cozy atmosphere, amicable staff, and concise and attractive menu choices, The Everyday Market is a spot you shouldn't skip.

Staff were very friendly, offered recommendations, and were overall pleasant to order from.

My caprese sandwich was a fantastic pairing of flavors with great balance. The sandwich features bread packed with flavor and texture, juicy tomatoes, and robust and distinct cheese that comes together to form the complete package. Portion size felt just right. Well worth the price of 10.95.

Make sure you stop by if you're in the area!

Nestled in the heart of Belmont, NC, The Everyday Market is not just another neighborhood cafe. It's a delightful escape from the daily grind, where the community converges to relish life's simple pleasures. Drawing inspiration from the quaint European cafes, this establishment offers a serene space for locals and visitors to unwind and indulge.

One cannot emphasize enough the warm and friendly atmosphere that envelops you when you step in.

The staff exudes genuine warmth and hospitality, making every visit feel like a reunion with old friends.

And while every item on their menu is a testament to their commitment to quality and taste, the almond croissants deserve a special mention. These pastries are nothing short of divine. Perfectly flaky on the outside, with a rich and creamy almond filling, they are a delightful treat that beckons you to return for more.

The Everyday Market is a gem in Belmont's historic downtown. Whether you're looking for a cozy spot to catch up with friends or treat yourself to some delectable made-from-scratch food and exceptional coffee, this is the place to be. Highly recommended!

We've been here twice, and both times, it's been great! Food is on point and the coffee is always good as well. Bathrooms are clean and smell good. Staff is kind and helpful. I can't find any reasons not to give 5 stars.

Perfect little spot with delicious food that is served fast and hot!
Coffee, tea, pastries and decadent desserts are all options. Plus a mini bottle shop with many wines, cider and beer.
Relaxing music, free wifi, indoor and outdoor seating options, accepts cash and card.

The displays of incredible foods are impressive and the holiday decor is a great touch!
On my trip to the everyday market I bought an espresso shot, I absolutely adored the environment! Delicious looking food and very friendly staff!
Just had an outer body experience eating a caprese sandwich here. I would describe eating their food as enjoyable and refreshing. I don't live super close to here but will be back!!

The sweets are decent, and usually when I get a hot chocolate from here it's good but today I learned when coming in right before they close DONT. If I really wanted something that tasted like watered down chocolate milk that was slightly heated up for the price I'd make it at home. Not to mention I don't mind hurrying out so the shop can close but dang being rushed out like I was in my opinion was rude.

They make some really good coffee here. I really enjoyed the latte art. I wanted to get a dessert too. They look comparable to Amelie's! Although, I kind of miss Caravan's chill atmosphere. This place seems busy and it felt like a get in, order and get out kind of situation. Overall, it worth going back again, but I think I'll just get it to go.

Let's just say I hate sandwiches but they made me love sandwiches. The bread is freshly made there, I pick a new sandwich 3 days in a row and I was amazed by how DELICIOUS these sandwiches are. I'm Jamaican so I love flavor. I had a lot of baked goods from them too. THE OWNER, best guy ever, very welcoming and kind. Great staff too

Friendly service and great coffee and tea. My Starbucks addict husband loved the batch roast and I enjoyed the mild but tasty Benner Englishbreakfadt tea.  I'm a baked goods/pastries snob and there is a wide selection here, cookies,sweet crossaints, tiramisu, macarons, cheesecakes, lemon bars. I absolutely love the hazelnut crunch bar, it has a hazelnut mousse layer, a crunchy bottom (mysterious!) and a thin chocolate ganache layer on top. I shouldn't let everyone know about this because I fear it won't be there next time I go, but fair is fair ,and you're welcome.
Oh and they have some other foods but I never can try them because I want all my calories for the desserts. Sweet shelves with wines and gourmet type grocery items I've not seen elsewhere too. Pretty ceramic olive oil jugs are among them. When in Belmont, don't miss it.
..

This is such a hidden gem in the Charlotte food scene. My husband and I finally tried it right before we left. We got:

- Brisket Burrito
- Almond Croissant
- Bread Pudding
- Carrot Cake

Their pastries are phenomenal. I can't pick a favorite. I can say that if you haven't been here, you should go immediately. They're some of the best pastries in Charlotte.
Perfect macarons, delicious coffee.
Great coffee and friendly service!

I frequently visit this remarkable coffee shop, and they have exceptional quality food and drinks, all thanks to their dedicated staff. The baristas here are truly amazing, creating coffee that's nothing short of outstanding and being so kind. The baking crew creates the most decadent and delicious pastries. With all the items, the crew provide their best and serves them to perfection and with a smile. Don't miss the chance to experience their passion and incredible drinks!

There's no wrong thing to order here! My favorites are the brisket burrito, the French toast and anything croissant! (Side note: these croissants are possibly the closest to an actual French croissant you will find in NC).

The coffee here is not an after thought - it's really good. So order your favorite caffeinated beverage and sit outside facing the park. This place is bumpin' but the service is always great. Smiles all around, helpful suggestions and genuine customer service.

The place can get a bit loud inside, but it's because it is literally the hub of Belmont. Great food, great coffee, great service and you will likely see your neighbors!
Very cute place and good food. I had the mixed berry muffin and a raspberry pastry. Both were tasty. I think everyone left happy with what they had.

Starbucks who? The atmosphere is chill ... the customer service is 100. Their food is charming. I don't want to eat it but yet flavorful. The staff literally acknowledges everyone that walks through the door. These are no store bought pastries neither sandwiches but made to order. This is pastry artistry at its finest ... not to mention the cafe and the wine ... Perfect combination  ... to catch the before, during and after work crowd. The idea behind this business is nothing short of amazing serving their community. Please come here and support all things local in BELMONT
Great little place downtown Belmont, started off as a simple coffee shop then they expanded with a bakery. My wife and had a great breakfast this morning.
I decided to try the avocado toast to see what all fuss was about with my fellow millennials. Nice folks and ample seating during a weekday lunch hour.
Love this place. Recommend it to everyone I know.

What a great shop! I went in tonight looking for something sweet that wasn't ice cream and came here. Their Chai latte is perfect, not watery like the chain stores they had a tray of ricotta and pesto foccacia out to sample and it was delicious. I had the lemon bar when I got home and it was absolutely perfect. I can't wait to have the pecan pie tomorrow!

I have visited many of the restaurants in Belmont.  This market is exceptional with outstanding foods and service.  It shows the owners are committed to having a first class market friendly to all who visit.
Fun place to stop in for a bite and coffee. Popular spot for food and coffee.
If they are busy the wait can be long, but the Salmon toast is worth it.

First time I've been in. Overall good experience, just got lattes but service was friendly and paced well. Atmosphere was nice, not too bright or dark, music was at a comfortable level. There was seating when we needed it, but I could see that being a challenge during peak times. Food options looked and smelled good, will need go back and try some ;-)

The best place to eat.  Owner is a very generous person. He makes sure that the customers get what they need. Me and my wife are vegetarians, he made sure that we get the food we need. In fact he has prepared and provided samples which is very rare for any owner of the eating please.  The staff are very cordial and the place is beautiful.  We are going to visit this place definitely every alternative week.
Loved this place! Thank you for your service and pastries!
Here is a nice cafe that feels very European. I enjoyed a nice latte and had the salmon toast. Amazing! Definitely give it a try!
Love coming here for great coffee, vibes, and people watching.

Awesome selection of cake and pastry! Espresso is top shelf. We were lucky to get there when it wasn't crowded. Crowds seemed to come and go pretty quickly. There's was a farmer's market across the street in the park. Very nice area!
I come every single morning before work. The coffee is the best around and the staff are so friendly.
My favorite spot on earth.
Delicious apricot, brie, and ham croissant.

So why not a 5 star? The food is wonderful and the display case is unique. You won't find many places with this amount of variety in options with food and drink. The staff is always kind and I would give this place a perfect 5 if it wasn't for the fact that if you stay here long enough you begin to realize the staff are never given proper brakes. I watched a staff member spend an hour attempting to eat his lunch because he constantly had to go back and forth to taking orders. No one covered for him either. People can't take 5, 10 minutes to let someone eat their food before it goes cold? 3 stars. People need to take brakes or I can't be happy eating here.
This is a very exquisite place to have food and coffee I would highly recommend to come here. The food and coffee are top-tier!

Cute little shop where we stopped for coffee and tried their in house vanilla iced latte. SO delicious! You can also pick up wine, order food, sit inside or outside, and directly across the street is a BEAUTIFUL area to walk with many benches, flowers and a fountain. Great way to start a beautiful day.

Really good coffee! The pastries and sandwiches are a bit overpriced.

Let's just say they are priced for the individual I suppose. Not family friendly prices.

But nonetheless, everything looked & tasted great!

An atheistically pleasing location perfecting for catching up with loved ones.
Great desserts and salmon, and avocado toast. The coffee was good. Recommend for breakfast. Did not like only that was no high chair available. Not toddlers-friendly for dining in.

I was staying in Belmont area and wanted breakfast before going to the airport. I found this place and loved it. The employees are extremely nice, the food was great, and I will definitely be back when i travel here again!!!
Adorable and delicious - this place made my day so much better after one of the other local restaurants left me feeling very excluded and even unwelcome.
The spinach quiche with side salad was excellent. The matcha wasn't mixed well though. Food good, drinks okay.

What a pleasant and cozy place, first time going and it was a delight,,service was outstanding, food and desserts delish, but the coffee was amaizing, very family oriented, very lovely place,,for sure we'll be back again.
Happy Mother's Day.
Have a very Blessed Day.

Honestly one star is too much for this place! The customer service was AWFUL!! I went there with my mother and the lady was so racist against her. She kept staring at her as well, she also brought everyone's food to their table except ours she made us get up and get it. I would never go there again in my life and I would never recommend this place to anyone in my life!
Not the usual fare..  very good!

Love this place! Delicious coffee. Delicious food. Quaint. Good wine selections. And excellent customer service. I live all the way in Huntersville and will drive all the way here any chance I get to have breakfast. 10/10. (HIGHLY recommend the lemon bars!)

Tantalizing desserts and sandwiches.
Quick service.
Love stopping in here with friends to relax and catch up.
A perfect meeting spot.
An adorable and delicious full service coffee and bakery and Cafe. They have sandwiches and a brisket burrito and an array of baked goods. The spicy turkey is truly excellent.
Such a delightful place!
We had coffee and caramel pecan cheesecake and it was phenomenal. Nice atmosphere and great service. One of the nicest spots on Main Street in Belmont.

Every single item I have tried has been beyond delicious! They also catered our dessert retirement party and oh my goodness, everyone raved about the desserts! They looked and tasted AMAZING! The staff is wonderful, helpful and the ordering process was super easy. Thank you Everyday Market!

I truly cannot stop thinking about how wonderful our visit to this spot was! We went about a month ago and had a slice of blueberry cheesecake and some cava and I wish I could go back there every day to try all the things! The FOH staff was delightful, but not overly cheerful/fake and the BOH was bustling making amazing looking creations. Top Notch!
Pastries are great. Delicious macaroons.
Our go to spot! We love the Everyday Market and bring everyone we know here... Nice to have a local spot where people know your name and your order
Delicious spinach quiche.  Best I've ever had!
Becoming one of my favorite hot spots!
I would give this place 5 stars if they could make sandwiches to order but overall it all tastes great.
Good place to take my business collogues ... Wife and I also like to stop here for an after dinner espresso and desert.
Cute coffee shop with nice selection of items.  Service was good as well, ate some sandwiches which we enjoyed alot.

Pleasant experience. The food was delicious. Pricey for just a sandwich and slice of cake. Overall, it was a good experience. Quaint, quiet, and clean. It is a good place to stop for coffee and a snack.
Love this place. Coffee is awesome and the people is great.
it hella gud!!!
Vanilla oatmik latte here is one the best coffees I ever had. Staff here are very friendly

This gives me almost everything except wifi. The drinks here are very good. So are the snacks. Everyone is always so genuinely friendly when I come. I get the feeling that they provide a good work environment for the staff because it shows. Just wish the wifi worked but it's fine. I'll still choose this coffee shop if I'm around.  Plus their chai latte was really good.
Love this place!
It was my Saturday breakfast spot when I lived nearby. Now I go any chance I get when I am up that way. Still one of my favorites!
Very small place but the food was excellent. If were ever back in town we would definitely return.

Love The Everyday Market and so does everyone else. The food is so delicious! The only downsides are that it gets busy on the weekends and that it is pricier than some of the other cafes in the area. Honestly though it is worth it for the cookies and pastries they have available.
My addiction.  love this place too much. The spinach quiche is always my go to.
All employees working hard and super friendly

Nothing special - this place is fine for a cup of coffee but we have been 3 times and have been disappointed each time. Today the marble brownie was extremely dry and hard and the woman at the register was absolutely miserable. I think this was the 3rd strike, time to try a different place.
Very nice market for coffee, pasties, out a light breakfast. Extremely popular so it's may be a little busy.
Best coffee shop in Gaston County!
Excellent place for coffee and conversation.  The food choices are awesome
Come here to chart for work remotely every Friday. Beautiful location with friendly staff and good options.
I love this place! Majid makes the best pastries and could handle his own in a season of British Bake off if given the chance. This is a must try pastry shop (with some sandwiches not pictured sorry)
The Bourbon Brownie was amazing.  Some of the macarons were good, but most of the flavors tasted artificial. Their espresso shots were very under-extracted (sour).
Good food and good people.

I stood at the counter needing to order a few boxes of mixed sweets.  Not acknowledged by anyone ! Every employee saw me just none acknowledged me. I finally told 1 employee I needed some items. She seriously said let me help the man behind you 1st  WTH ! He proceeded to go around me and ordered a FOOD item & beverage. Again. ..WTH. The owner mgr whatever the older guy is meandered past me then went to the back without even...Hello 
Have you been helped  Beep bop boo bop ... anything.
Horribly rude. btw no other counter customer except me as the prior had checked out.
Check your camera for the invisible lady at 3:35 (just now) 9/23.
Btw I'm sitting st WH should you want to apologize with a piece of chess pie.

99 sanitation score, super clean kitchen and staff, very friendly, very popular place. Love the new look, it's very fresh. Wish my latte was hotter but giving 5 stars anyway bc I drank it all and wished I had more.
Excellent Spinach Quiche! The staff was friendly and lots of yummy options. I didn't try the coffee, but will definitely the next time I visit.
Delish food and friendly staff.
Absolutely wonderful place. The food was VERY delicious.  Actually Amazing.  I will definitely be going back.

Great vibe, in a beautiful downtown, excellent coffee and foods, this coffee shop is my favorite in Belmont. The service staff is welcoming and kind--they smile and seem genuinely glad to see you. It's a good place to meet for really great coffee.

Usually an excellent experience. Noticed alot more staff, seems to have caused confusion. No staff at dessert counter, placed order at register and paid. Recieved someone elses order. Told my wife, this place is a mess today and just walked out. Gave this place anorher chance since previous review, and its not any better. Twice as muxh staff, half the service. Couldnt get any help at counter, so we walked out and went to floyd and blackies.

8/11/22 We went again to try different foods, and we weren't disappointed! Amazing staff too! 5/2021 Delicious! Try this place out one morning for breakfast. We went again 12/2/21. The spinach quiche (homemade) was so smooth, wonderful for breakfast. Also tried today, BlackBerry strudel, cheesecake, and an egg/cheese croissant. I wish we could've eaten more, bought more! Support locally owned businesses. Great vibes here!

I often have the Quiche' which comes plated with a lovely small romaine salad with balsamic. We have endulged in several of the desserts. The Tarumsu is excellent.  They often have several different varieties of cheesecake. The coffee is always good. Their fresh assortment of cookies and crossaints (almond is my favorite) never dissapoint! Quaint southern shop with a pastry shop/chef flare. Well done. We visit often!
Absolutely love this place. What a great establishment for Belmont. Food is excellent coffee is so consistent and the staff is awesome.
This place is amazing.  Best milk foam I've had in a long time. Fantastic quiche.  Sweets and croissants way above average.
Great coffee and house made pastries. Dope AF.
Just had chicken salad croissant with a cappuccino...so worth the drive! Generous portion, delicious chicken salad recipe, and the local coffee was deep, rich and smooth. Love this place!
Have to stop here every time I come to Belmont, NC. They have great coffee, great atmosphere, and the best treats.

One of my favorite spots in Belmont! Perfect location right near the park, delicious food, and friendly staff. The desserts are INCREDIBLE! It's hard to choose a favorite so I will recommend the macarons (earl grey and rose are my faves), the tiramisu, and the chocolate ganache cake.  Oh and the carrot cake is also amazing! And did I mention the lovely little market with pasta and sauces to buy and take home? So glad this place is in Belmont.

Everyday Market is the heart of Belmont. It is a chef driven coffee shop, you will not believe the sandwiches and pastries that come from this unassuming coffee shop. There is a small section of Italian dry goods, perfect if you love to cook or need a hostess gift. A great selection of beer and wine. All your vices covered. Caffeine,  sugar and booze.

Love this bakery. I ordered a slice of their homemade quiche and it was so delicious that I bought a whole spinach quiche to go. Served it today for a party of six and everyone kept talking about how tasty it was throughout the whole brunch. Why make it?
Great to go breakfast option. Ham, egg and cheese croissant is a family favorite and they make a good cup of coffee.
This is a wonderful coffee shop. Great employees, comfortable atmosphere, and the owner himself is a very capable, kind gentleman.

Patrons, beware! I'm giving it 1 star only because the employees that took and fixed our order was kind and courteous. It was our first time, my husband and I, and we went on a Friday evening and it wasn't busy at all, which was great. I was excited and saw they had some appealing items in their window display. We ordered a few desserts (to bring home) and decided to dine in and enjoy a cup of latte with a brisket veggie empanada. We paid for our order and sat down in front of the window display, waiting for our empanada and latte. As we sat waiting, we both witnessed one of the workers handling our empanada with her bare hands and throughout the time that she had transferred it from the window display to the oven(s), she was touching her mouth, her hair, her clothes, her ears and went back to touching the empanada with her unclean hands. I was shocked and reluctantly (bc I didn't want to complain and be "those" customers) went to tell the cashier and wanted a refund on the empanada. Somehow, a man from the kitchen, I guess the owner, started talking over the window display to my husband, in which he stood up and walked over to him and the man started explaining that even though they handle their food with bare hands, any and all germs and bacteria that was on that person's bare hands would've been been eliminated while baking/cooking in the 400 degree oven. I was disgusted and appalled that someone would encourage this kind of practice at a restaurant, amidst covid and all the food born illnesses out there. We were calm and explained to him that no one should be handling food with unclean hands (I'm sure there's plastic gloves or a spatula/tong somewhere), but he insisted that his hot ovens were going to kill the bacteria. He assured us he wasn't arguing with us, only "educating" us on how it's ok to contaminate food and eliminate bacteria with hot ovens. True or not, no food personnel who cooks and serves to the public (or to anyone) should handle food that way!  Who wants to eat spoiled food, regardless if the hot temperature killed the germs or not, just the thought of the filthy actions of the employee is horrific! Truly flabbergasted! Now I think of it, I should've refunded the desserts too because of his "bacteria-killing-hot-oven" theory. Praying that whoever baked the desserts had better and cleaner work ethics.. He really needs to take a serve safe/food safety class!!
Such a great place to get a coffee pastries or a sandwich it's very clean and the people are very friendly

They don't allow pick up orders which is peculiar to me at best. They didn't want to tell me their kitchen hours so I would know when they're open. I called at 2:40 pm and she said they were closed so I asked when they're open, she gave me the run around. Like I'm just trying to place an order lady and not having luck, thought you could be helpful but apparently they aren't taking new customers in....I didn't know the food business got so full they turn away business..Ameli's has wonderful quiche! So I continue going there!

Don't order anything from this bakery, they will make you pay in advance and then they won't make it. Do not depend on them to make anything for your special occasions. The manager also shared personal information about her staff as an explanation to why the product was not made. Treat your staff with this respect. I have supported this place for 2 years now but they have lost a customer.
Stopped by on our way to Charlotte. Food and coffee were 10/10, service was great, and the dessert was so delicious! Lemon bar was my personal favourite!

My favorite spot!
They have everything!!!

I have been a regular customer here since it's beginning.  It seems lately there has been a huge turnover of staff. The overall attitudes have changed drastically for the worse. I always enjoy stopping in for a bakery treat or frozen coffee drink.The owner recommended a slightly special version of the frappe and I order it quite frequently.  For some reason, certain employees have difficulty with my order (it's not complicated and I explain it very nicely). Today was no exception so I asked to speak to the owner. His response was very out of character as he demanded there would be no more "special " drinks allowed. I couldn't believe how rude he was to a loyal customer that just wanted a simple frappe! Not sure what other problems are going on there, but I will never visit there again. I am beyond mortified at this level of service.
Great coffee, outstanding staff, and decedent desserts. They also have wine! A European style cafe in Belmont.
Food wasn't very good. Croissant sausage was really salty and the breads were dry and stale.
Always love stopping in for a coffee and pastry on our bike ride.  Great staff and incredible eats! Check it out!
Everything is always delicious here. The place is so cute & quaint inside. Just a nice place to hang out & relax.
I love coming here to get some work done and enjoy a nice coffee. The food is great, I always get the salmon toast, highly recommended! Very kind atmosphere, go check it out.

A staple of Belmont! Always fresh food and great coffee. I crave their lemon bars on a weekly basis. A relaxed atmosphere to work or meetup with friends. Skip Starbucks--support local and get a much better product.
Fantastic desserts, food and a great wine selection.   An awesome addition to Belmont.

Everything was amazing! From the service to the coffee to the almond croissant (oh my god...truly unreal) to the ham egg and cheese breakfast sandwich. Wow. Might move to NC just to visit this place more often...
Great local spot with nice variety of treats.

Everyday market is a great place to eat
I am giving it 3 stars because parking was challenging and to get a sit was challenging too.
We waited long to be able to get a sit. I would recommend to go here only Monday to Friday. On weekends, parking and getting a sit will be tough.
Great coffee and amazing food!!

The ham egg and cheese everything bagel is one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had outside of New York!

Stop in for so many amazing culinary creations! Sandwiches, baked goods, beer, wine and of course, coffee!
Seriously THE BEST salmon toast I have EVER had! Kudos!!  I will definitely be back and will certainly  bring my family when they come into town!
Belmonts staple coffee shop. Try the iced latte and the lemon pound cake. Or anything else that is fresh out of the oven!
First time here and had the avacado toast which was beautiful AND delicious. The best thing I have eaten in recent memory. I was so sad when it was gone. We will be back for more!

We initially went in for a few quick slices of cake after seeing they were a bakery/cafe but we were blown away by their selections, the quality of their desserts, and the friendly atmosphere.  We were so impressed we went back the next day for brunch.  I recommend the chocolate cakes, the Irish White Chocolate Latte,  breakfast burritos, and anything on their croissants.  But that's all I've had so far, and can't wait to try more.  An absolute gem of a place!
Majid is truly a master!  His baked goods are pieces of art, and almost too beautiful to eat....almost.  Yet, they taste even better than they look.
Best coffee shop in Belmont
Owner/manager is rude and condescending. I will never go back!
Excellent spot for a great coffe and croissants with Brie cheese, this places transport you to Europe.
Great place for coffee and a snack. Good atmosphere and nice people.
The food was fresh and yummy.

A must visit! Yummy eats, Fantastic treats, and amazing selection of wines and beer. Very laid back, easy going, friendly familiar type of place. One of those places that checks every box. Before you know it, you've become a regular going a few times a week. Check it out!
Great location amazing food and beverage.
Great place!!
They had desserts, there, they had everything I could ever imagine, it was so much like ah mles, but just a little better than Emily's.
Great iced coffee and hot Chai tea. The egg and cheese croissant was wonderful. My wife had the brisket breakfast burrito and really enjoyed it. Nice spot, great people!
My favorite coffee shop. Love the macarons!! The vanilla and pistachio flavors are my favorite!
Cute coffee shop across from Stowe Park. Ordered a hot chocolate, it was delicious. Friendly staff. Nice interior environment. They also sell desserts and breakfast items.
Tea, breakfast sandwiches, and pastries. Delicious

Every visit to The Everyday Market, there is always a new item to try, today was hazelnut, pistachio, chocolate mousse tarts, open face croque monsieur and ham, apricot, brie croissant. This unassuming coffee shop is way more than coffee. Fresh pastries, cookies, sandwiches, salads, avocado toast, flatbreads and beer and wine. Count me in.
Quaint little coffee shop with delicious snacks and bakery items. Even better were the nice people.  Everything we ate and drank was fantastic. Definitely visit here.
Amazing quiche and pastries. Coffee is mediocre.
I've been a few times now and always have a good experience. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Really enjoy the coffee and bakery selections.
Breakfast here rocks.

Love this place! The desserts are some of the best I've had in the Charlotte area! Super flavorful and delicious every time! Coffee is eh but the macrons, the lemon bars, the sandwiches, rugala is all so good! I wish they had a bigger selection! The only ding I would give is price, it's expensive so I don't come as much as I want too
We love it here! Everything we've tried has been delicious  We will definitely be back!

The best bread pudding anywhere in the Char-Meck MSA!!!  Belmont is so lucky to have this bskery/coffee shop downtown!  And Charlotteans are blessed to live so close to Belmont. Go ahead.  Take a quick drive to Belmont and enjoy a relaxed visit to this nice spot.. I promise you will love.  And then take a nice stroll downtown Belmont's beautiful streets and shops.
Creative array of delicious bites!!  Can't wait to go back!!

Talk about exactly what downtown Belmont needed, a no frills coffee shop that serves some of the best pastries and sandwiches around! Very friendly staff delicious coffee and foods....oh and did I mention you could grab a bottle of wine and a couple glasses and enjoy it on their patio!

Nice place to eat dessert in Belmont. May come back someday to try other food. Got macarons (or macaroons, don't know the difference) and I liked them. My favorite was the coconut. They do need a minute to chill before you eat them considering they come from a fridge (their food is still fresh) or else it will be kinda tough.

The lemon bar and the marble brownie were also great (says my boyfriend)

Finally, loved the strawberry smoothie.

Staff was kind and very responsive. Came on a Saturday and it wasn't too busy

It's a good concept and needed in Belmont. However the bagel sandwich was super tough. Toasted too much prior to giving it to me and very bready. I won't have that again but will try the other selections. The iced vanilla latte was amiss. Way too sweet and didn't even taste like my friend's drink who ordered the same thing but hot which doesn't make sense.
Absolutely fantastic spot with very good coffee and the best cheesecake I've ever had. 7/5 stars
Just tried the everything bagel sandwich and it was amazing!! My husband had the salmon quiche and it was delicious as well! I haven't had anything here that I didn't love!
The atmosphere alone is worth the trip, my girlfriend and I both enjoyed our drinks to the fullest and the staff were great!
Recently expanded and just as good if not better than before. The egg/cheese croissant was so light and fluffy but still filling
Really awesome bakery and they serve Hex Coffee so you know it's good!
I love this place, when you walk in you feel clean relaxed and friendly
The bakery items are out of this world good. So many flavorful and amazing options to pick from. I highly recommend the Danish and macaroons.
Delicious. I had a cronut and German chocolate cake. Best I've ever had. I can't say enough good things.

My husband and I have admittedly been here thrice this week. The cronut is heavenly and the quiche is some of the best I've had in a while, the salad that comes with it is a nice touch. Really great coffee as well!
You must go. Sandwiches, almond croissants, empanadas too the macaroons are so delicious. They even have coffee.
The blueberries tart is so good!
This was my first stop when i got to NC more than two years ago, and every time i go its a pleasant service, good quality and fair business. Godspeed.
Great customer service!! Coffee and tomato soup is excellent. Location is great and convenient, near the park and other shops.

DELICIOUS! The perf spot to grab breakfast to go or eat on their patio. Everyone is friendly and welcoming! Plus they sell wine & desserts for evening relaxing. A must-stop if you're in downtown Belmont!

This place is amazing. Quaint, but so much depth. It's almost like they have a big city master of pastry working in the beauty of small town Belmont. The Bistro style dining room is cozy but layed out very well for comfort, privacy, and (these days) safety. The display cases are filled with some of the most creative and classic confections and plenty of savory options for breakfast and lunch. The Empanadas are a must. Loaded with perfectly seasoned meats and veggies, they really don't need the exceptional dipping sauce, but I'm very happy it is added. Professional coffee service with well researched beans show that the owners know their coffee! It's a must try. You won't find this in many places, and I'm glad I found it in such a beautiful little town.
This place is a hidden gem. Great people, food and atmosphere. This is a must go when in town enjoying the sites.
